definitions: To dress oneself in an item of clothing or accessory.
To activate or start a device or machine.
To apply a substance to a surface.
To schedule or present a performance, show, or event.
To pretend or feign an emotion or characteristic.
examples: She decided to put on her new dress for the party.
Please put on the light; it's getting dark.
He needs to put on some sunscreen before going outside.
The theater group will put on a play next month.
I've put on a few pounds over the holidays.
Don't put on an act; I know you're upset.
pastTenses: put something on, put something on
